intro: Senecio bolivarianus, commonly known as the Bolivian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and grayish-green, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Senecio bolivarianus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
